choice.text: What can you tell me about the plant near Tszappur's tent?

node.text: Oh, that's Tealeaves. They've only arrived recently and they're still discovering themselves, but they're of a mind to remain here for the time being as a chandler. If you need a recoiler, they would be the one to ask.
node.choice: They mentioned that the Consortium is "spawn-sirring" them?

node.text:
{{emote|*The wardens laugh.*}}
They mean to say that they're being sponsored. They've an agreement with the Consortium; they are provided with goods to sell, and in exchange they pay a tithe of their water.

I thought so too. Given the nature of the request, I made sure that I was present during the negotiations, and the church retains full authority to make changes to the sponsorship's terms as needed. The Consortium lacks a permanent fixture within the Stiltgrounds, and so thus far they have been willing to acquiesce if it means having a representative within the bazaar.
Don't worry. We intend to ensure that they retain their independence and have space to grow without the Consortium making them into a tool to be used. I hope that helps to soothe your fears.
